outsider.devtools 0.1.0
  • Basic Introduction
  • Advanced Introduction
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Build a module

module_build.Rd

Do

module_build(flpth = getwd(), tag = NULL, build_documents = TRUE,
  build_package = TRUE, build_image = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

flpth

File path to location of module.
tag

Docker tag, e.g. latest.
build_documents

Build R documentation? T/F
build_package

Build R package? T/F
build_image

Build Docker image? T/F
verbose

Be verbose? T/F

Value

Logical

See also

Other build: module_check, module_identities, module_skeleton, module_test, module_travis, module_upload

Examples

library(outsider)
#> ----------------
#> outsider v 0.1.0
#> ----------------
#> - Security notice: be sure of which modules you install
# build a skeleton package
flpth <- tempdir()
mdl_pth <- module_skeleton(program_name = 'example', repo_user = 'github_user',
                           docker_user = 'docker_user', flpth = flpth)
# look-up module user and program name/ids
# note: "om.." is added to the beginning of the program name
# mdl_pth <- file.path(flpth, 'om..example')
# (ids <- module_identities(flpth = mdl_pth))
# # generate .travis.yml
# module_travis(repo = ids$`GitHub repo`, flpth = mdl_pth)
# cat(readLines(file.path(mdl_pth, '.travis.yml')), sep = '\n')
# # check the package is formatted correctly
# module_check(flpth = mdl_pth)


# clean-up
unlink(x = mdl_pth, recursive = TRUE)
